Global Auto Parts Manufacturing Market Share, Size, Analysis, Growth, Forecast: By Component: Battery, Cooling System, Underbody Components, Engine Components, Automotive Filter, Lighting Components, Electrical Components, Others; By Sales Channel; By Vehicle Type; Regional Analysis; Competitive Landscape; 2018-2028

  • Table of Contents

Global Auto Parts Manufacturing Market Outlook 

The global auto parts manufacturing market attained a value of USD 660.24 billion in 2022. The market is estimated to grow at a CAGR of 6.26% during 2023-2028 to reach a value of USD 939.21 billion by 2028. 

 

Read more about this report - REQUEST FREE SAMPLE COPY IN PDF

 

The Asia Pacific to Present Lucrative Growth Opportunities for the Auto Parts Manufacturing Market

The Asia Pacific emerged as a significant market for auto parts manufacturing in 2020. The region is also anticipated to be a major global market in the forecast period as well, witnessing a robust growth rate. New technology applications in the field of producing automotive parts are expected to boost the automotive sales in the region. The regional market is being driven by an increase in the production and sales of vehicles and passenger cars and the digitisation of distribution systems for automotive components.

Governments around the globe also have stringent vehicle emission regulations for product manufacturers to manufacture environmentally sustainable and highly effective automobile products for both the domestic and international markets, which is likely to boost the market demand. In recent years, there have been considerable development in the automotive industry, with developing markets like China, India, and Brazil anticipated to boost market growth globally.

 

Auto Parts Manufacturing: Market Segmentation

Auto parts, such as transmission and power train parts, motors and engine components, body parts and trimmers, electronics, and braking systems, as well as steering and suspension components, are manufactured by various entities, which are then used in the production of automobiles. 

 

Read more about this report - REQUEST FREE SAMPLE COPY IN PDF

 

Based on component, the market can be divided into the following:

  • Battery
  • Chassis System
  • Cooling System
    • Compressor
    • Radiator
    • Pump
    • Thermostat
  • Underbody Components
    • Brake Components
    • Exhaust Components
  • Engine Components
    • Starter
    • Pump
    • Engine
    • Alternator
  • Automotive Filter
  • Lighting Components
  • Electrical Components
    • Ignition Coil
    • Ignition Switch
    • Spark and Glow Plug
  • Others

On the basis of sales channel, the market can be segmented into:

  • OEM
  • Aftermarket

By vehicle type, the market can be divided into:

  • Passenger Cars
  • Light Commercial Vehicles
  • Heavy Commercial Vehicles
  • Others

The regional markets for auto parts manufacturing can be divided into North America, Europe, the Asia Pacific, Latin America, and the Middle East and Africa.

 

Read more about this report - REQUEST FREE SAMPLE COPY IN PDF

 

New Innovations in Automotive Industry Guiding the Market Growth of Auto Parts Manufacturing

The automotive industry is rapidly growing due to the introduction of new innovations, which is bolstering the growth of the auto parts manufacturing industry. Therefore, the key players are aligning their strategies to the prevalent trends in order to maintain competitiveness in such a dynamic environment. For example, the demand for auto parts manufacturing is expected to expand in the coming years by introducing the latest technology in automotive engine radiators. Leading industries are now planning to manufacture lightweight car parts to produce components, which are significantly lightweight and much more fuel-efficient than their predecessors. Owing to stricter environmental regulations leading to the replacements in motor cars and their engines, the amount of scrap is higher in developed countries compared to the developing world. Similarly, in developed countries, the use of new technologies and innovations in motors like hybrid motors is more prevalent than developing countries. The demand for manufacturing new vehicles with reduced consumption of fuel is stimulated by increasing government support with relatively stricter emission standards, resulting in the higher demand for automotive parts. These factors are expected to support the growth of the global market for auto parts manufacturing.

Key Questions Answered in the Report

What was the global auto parts manufacturing market size in 2022?

In 2022, the global auto parts manufacturing market attained a value of USD 660.24 billion in 2022.

What is the growth rate of the market?

The market is projected to grow at a CAGR of 6.26% between 2023 and 2028.

What is the forecast outlook of the market for 2023-2028?

The market is estimated to witness a healthy growth in the forecast period of 2023-2028 to reach about USD 939.21 billion by 2028.

What are the major market drivers?

The major drivers of the market, such as the rising production and sales of vehicles, growing digitisation of distribution systems, and increasing technological advancements and innovations, are expected to aid the market growth.

What are the key industry trends of the global auto parts manufacturing market?

The key market trends guiding the growth of the industry include the rising implementation of stringent vehicle emission regulations and the growing introduction of environmentally sustainable automobile products.

What are the major regional markets of auto parts manufacturing, according to the EMR report?

The major regions in the industry are North America, Latin America, the Middle East and Africa, Europe, and the Asia Pacific.

What are the leading components in the market?

The leading components in the market are battery, cooling system, underbody components, chassis system, engine components, automotive filter, lighting components, electrical components, and transmission and steering system, among others.

What are the major sales channels in the market?

The major sales channels in the market are OEM and aftermarket.

What are the significant vehicle types in the market?

The significant vehicle types in the market are passenger cars, light commercial vehicles, and heavy commercial vehicles, among others.

Who are the key market players, according to the report?

The major players in the market are Robert Bosch GmbH, DENSO CORPORATION, Continental AG, ZF Friedrichshafen AG, Hyundai Motor Group, Aisin Corporation, Magna International Inc., Valeo, Lear Corporation, Yazaki Group,  Sumitomo Electric Industries, Ltd., Tenneco Inc., Akebono Brake Industry Co., Ltd., Panasonic Holdings Corporation, Faurecia S.E., Marelli Holdings Co., Ltd, among others.

Analyst Review

The global auto parts manufacturing market attained a value of USD 660.24 billion in 2022, driven by the rising demand for passenger vehicles. Aided by the rapid technological advancements, the market is expected to witness a further growth in the forecast period of 2023-2028, growing at a CAGR of 6.26%. The market is projected to reach USD 939.21 billion by 2028.

EMR’s meticulous research methodology delves deep into the market, covering the macro and micro aspects of the industry. By component, the market is divided into battery, cooling system, underbody components, chassis system, engine components, automotive filter, lighting components, electrical components, and transmission and steering system, among others. Based on sales channel, the market is bifurcated into OEM and aftermarket. On the basis of vehicle type, the market is segmented into passenger cars, light commercial vehicles, and heavy commercial vehicles, among others. The major regional markets for auto parts manufacturing are North America, Europe, the Asia Pacific, Latin America, and the Middle East and Africa. The key players in the above market include Robert Bosch GmbH, DENSO CORPORATION, Continental AG, ZF Friedrichshafen AG, Hyundai Motor Group, Aisin Corporation, Magna International Inc., Valeo, Lear Corporation, Yazaki Group,  Sumitomo Electric Industries, Ltd., Tenneco Inc., Akebono Brake Industry Co., Ltd., Panasonic Holdings Corporation, Faurecia S.E., Marelli Holdings Co., Ltd, among others.

EMR’s research methodology uses a combination of cutting-edge analytical tools and the expertise of their highly accomplished team, thus, providing their customers with market insights that are accurate, actionable, and help them remain ahead of their competition.
